page.title: 12WESTFIELD OPEN-PIT MINE
page.content: February 1985 brought the end of 24 years coaling by Costain mining at Westfield,{the deepest open pit {coalmine in Europe,}with a production total of 34,500,000 tonnes of coal. Often described as the{biggest man {made hole in Scotland,}the Westfield pit near Kinross in Fife has been a highly successful operation. Westfield was developed in four stages from 1961 onwards and has produced a total of some 22 million tonnes of washed coal- that is coal in which certain impurities have been removed The four contracts were let in 1961,1968,1973 and 1976. The fourth stage is a separate pit on the south side of the B9097 road and has been mined by open cast methods. This mine has just been exhausted and the company is in the process of reinstating the land.
